Bag O' Links - 30/10/2009 by Elad Meidar

30 Oct 2009

  • sammy – super awesome javascript MVC framework, based on jQuery and feels like sinatra. looking good.
  • underscore.js – a functional javascript library, based on jQuery too with some cool extends to javascript objects. pay attention to the discussion on Reddit
  • intro to Ruby – by Brian Hogan – awesome slides by @bphogan, bare through the “Programming is fun” slide and enjoy :)
  • Explorer Exposed – common bugs and fixes for IE hell.
  • Git Magic – another new Git book for all of you infidels/
  • Atlas – an Xcode style Interface builder for web applications, coming soon.
  • cache_counter gotachs – a warning from Ryan Bigg.
  • 300 rails links – i don’t know how updated it is, use at your own risk.
  • pig – an Hadoop high level abstraction of parallel processing, super neat.
  • ThinkingSphinx RSpec matchers – test Thinking Spinx’s setup block.
  • imporving your code with Metric_fu – a good article from Devver.
  • Building an iPhone Application – a good post by DeveloperZen, covering the creation of a new application and the tools they used.
  • Off github – a solution by @hakunin to help in migrating your gems from github to gemcutter.

Treasures

  • nanite – scalable message queueing.
  • yUMLmeRails – Use yUML to generate Rails diagrams using RailRoad and Shoes
  • quick_serve – a super-simple way of serving static files for development. It was made mainly for javascript and css development, but might have other uses.

Related Posts

  • 08 Nov 2009 » Handle Facebook session expiry with Facebooker
  • 04 Nov 2009 » Bag O' Links - 3/11/2009
  • 28 Oct 2009 » Using BlackBird javascript console in Rails
